image.altText: Murray Watt speaking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Environment Minister Murray Watt will brief cabinet this morning before heading to South Australia to inspect the toxic algal bloom off the state's coast. Follow live.

title.children: Environment minister heads to SA to inspect toxic algal bloom

image.altText: Brown algae in water 3

props.synopsis: Calls are ramping up to recognise an algal bloom ravaging South Australian marine life for months as a national emergency. But what difference could such a declaration make?

title.children: Mounting pleas to declare algal bloom a national disaster

image.altText: Charlotte Walker and Mark Butler at a Labor campaign ev

props.synopsis: The new session of federal parliament is one of the youngest and most diverse ever. What is it like being a younger person in the corridors of power?

title.children: What it's like being the youngest person in parliament

image.altText: A selfie of a woman with dark hair, wearing an orange jumper

props.synopsis: Tanya Hinrichsen has been re-sentenced for helping her lover and his friend fatally stab and bash her husband in 2018 — after winning a retrial and pleading guilty to a charge of manslaughter. Warning: This story contains content that may distress some readers.

title.children: Wife jailed for role in helping lover fatally stab 'vulnerable' husband

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt, wearing a hat and sunglasses in the sheep yards

props.synopsis: The pressure from a lack of rain, feral goats, and kangaroos forces graziers across rural New South Wales to destock their properties.

title.children: Graziers battling dry and 'thousands' of kangaroos forced to destock

image.altText: Two rescue boats surround a small overturned silver boat in the ocean. A yatch in the distance

props.synopsis: Five people have been pulled from waters south of Adelaide after a boat capsized on Sunday, police say.

title.children: Two people in critical condition after boat capsized off metro Adelaide beach

image.altText: An Australian rules player leaps high into a pack and grasps the ball in both hands as players grimace around him.

props.synopsis: Football has evolved in the years since Barrie Robran hung up his boots, but as his beloved Roosters prepare to honour him following his death last week at the age of 77, tributes are continuing to flow for the man who, according to one eminent commentator, would have been a "champion in any era".

title.children: 'Bradman of footy' honoured by beloved Roosters

image.altText: A man kneels in front of a wall with faces of people painted on.

props.synopsis: Uncle Doug Nicholls is one of 20 Limestone Coast elders who tell their stories in a soon-to-be published book, passing on culture and learnings to the next generation.

title.children: Book preserves 'strength' of Indigenous elders for next generation

image.altText: A woman with brown hair wearing a blue coat looks off camera with a serious expression. Behind her are women wearing scrubs

props.synopsis: With a number of health unions undergoing wage bargaining with a state government elected on a promise to fix the ramping crisis, several unions are getting louder when it comes to challenges continuing to face the healthcare system, writes Kathryn Bermingham.

title.children: Increasing union loudness comes at same time health workers are in pay talks with SA government

image.altText: Two dolphins leaping out of the water

props.synopsis: Inside one of the world's only city-based dolphin sanctuary, the pod population has halved since becoming protected and experts fear some of their biggest challenges are ahead.

title.children: Dolphins in Australia's only city-based sanctuary still in need of protection

image.altText: Two people looking at the camera and smiling

props.synopsis: The siblings who discovered the body of Rosemary Brown 25 years ago have spoken for the first time, as police renew the search for her missing daughter Melissa Trussell.

title.children: Children linked to 25-year cold case speak for the first time

image.altText: A smiling large man in black jacket, light pants next to smiling, older, trim man holds a hose, next to grey holden.

props.synopsis: Malcolm Harris had only just learnt CPR when he used it to save a man's life in the 1980s. Four decades later, during a routine trip to the car wash, the 82-year-old retiree was the one who needed saving.

title.children: Fisherman uses 30 years of CPR training to save life at car wash

image.altText: Wide shot showing a suburban garden in Adelaide featuring a colourful array of foliage.

props.synopsis: How do you transform a blank-slate backyard into a plant-filled retreat when you don't have a clear plan or many resources? This Adelaide garden was built around existing fruit trees, using foolproof plants that were easy to propagate.

title.children: This garden was built on a small budget. Here are the key elements

image.altText: An elderly man sitting outdoors, smiling warmly while wearing a light gray hoodie

props.synopsis: ABC journalist Peter Ryan is being remembered by colleagues as a 'fierce' reporter and generous friend.

title.children: Late ABC journalist Peter Ryan celebrated for 'long and storied career'

image.altText: A large brick factory bearing the name "Ben Furney Flour Mills".

props.synopsis: Nonna's Bakehouse has lost a lawsuit against Dubbo-based Ben Furney Flour Mills after a judge found its bread issues were caused by internal recipe changes, not faulty flour.

title.children: Nonna's Bakehouse loses $2.5m lawsuit over 'inconsistent flour'

image.altText: An MRI machine in a clinic

props.synopsis: The 61-year-old was wearing a 9kg chain he uses for weight training when he entered the exam room to help his wife get off the MRI table.

title.children: US man dies after large chain necklace pulls him into MRI machine

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair and glasses looks serious while looking at something out of frame

props.synopsis: Yulia Svyrydenko says supplying Ukraine's army with what it needs to fight Russia is her top priority, but her new appointment has not pleased everyone.

title.children: Ukraine's new PM elevated after biggest wartime cabinet reshuffle

image.altText: Man in hoodie recording police officer on his phone during a violent protest in Essex, UK.

props.synopsis: Police arrest multiple people after protesters kicked and pelted police vans and injured officers in the south-east England town of Epping.

title.children: Missiles thrown at police as UK anti-immigrant protest turns violent

image.altText: A teenage boy with freckles standing face to face with a dark brown horse.

props.synopsis: For Cooper, the benefits of equine therapy have been life-changing. But under new changes to the NDIS, it's no longer funded.

title.children: Disability groups say new NDIS rules too 'medicalised'

image.altText: A child collects food in a pot, another is visibly distressed reaching out.

props.synopsis: At least 93 people have been killed while attempting to access aid in locations across Gaza, the civil defence agency in the Palestinian territory said.

title.children: At least 93 Gazans killed while waiting for aid, civil defence agency says

image.altText: The Japanese prime minister at a press conference from an election tallyroom.

props.synopsis: Exit polls show Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's ruling coalition has lost its majority in country's upper house, the latest in a string of poor election results.

title.children: Japanese PM vows to stay on despite election loss

image.altText: A head and shoulders shot of a smiling woman.

props.synopsis: A 27-year-old who led police to the bush grave of a Perth mother who had been murdered, after being lured to a suburban dog park, is sentenced to seven years in prison.

title.children: Accomplice who led police to murdered Perth woman's body jailed

image.altText: A beach on the Gold Coast with people on the beach

props.synopsis: Police are trying to uncover the identity of a woman, aged in her 70s, whose body was found on a Gold Coast beach. It is believed she had a medical episode.

title.children: Unidentified woman found dead at popular beach may have been homeless

image.altText: Vanessa in front of brick wall

props.synopsis: When Vanessa was made redundant last year, answering the question "What's next?" felt anything but simple.

title.children: I don't have a dream job which makes looking for work harder

image.altText: Young Tigers supporter watches the action from fence during Tiwi Islands grand final day

props.synopsis: Thousands of people flocked to the Tiwi Islands over the weekend to cheer on local teams at the islands' biggest event of the year, the revered annual footy grand final.

title.children: Footy, art and culture draw big crowds to Tiwi Islands on grand final day

image.altText: Image of crocodile shaped object on a small screen on a boat with blue skies and blue water in the background.

props.synopsis: Queensland's environment department investigates reports of a crocodile sighting at Noosa, after an experienced angler captures what he describes as a "very clear" image on underwater equipment.

title.children: Possible croc sighting at Noosa, 300km south of usual habitat

image.altText: A stethoscope on a table

props.synopsis: Low Medicare rebates and difficulty finding doctors are blamed for the closure of a medical service in regional WA.

title.children: Country WA town in limbo after shock closure of only GP clinic

image.altText: A photo from above a beach at Frankston South showing an unauthorised beach wall being built by a local resident.

props.synopsis: Gene Neill was told to stop work on an unauthorised retaining wall in March, but has continued regardless, saying he has to protect his Frankston South mansion from erosion.

title.children: Melbourne mansion owner defies order to take down concrete seawall

image.altText: An aerial photograph of Groote Eylandt

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old woman has been flown to hospital in Darwin after being allegedly speared in the head by a man known to her in a remote Northern Territory community.

title.children: Woman speared in head in alleged domestic violence attack

image.altText: An elderly man sat in a chair in a garden

props.synopsis: Patients in every state and territory can expect to wait months, if not years, for non-urgent public dental care.

title.children: Millions of Aussies skip dental care due to costs but there's a push to change this

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff dressed in court robes walks down a street. in Brisbane

props.synopsis: Walter Sofronoff's appeal against the ACT Integrity Commission's findings that he engaged in "serious corrupt conduct" has heard his actions were not "dishonest or malicious".

title.children: Sofronoff may have been wrong but 'not corrupt', lawyers argue

image.altText: Sussan Ley smiles as she walks down a corridor.

props.synopsis: When the federal parliament finally sits this week for the first time since the election, the full depth of the Liberal Party's electoral humiliation — just six Liberal women in the lower house — will be on display in the House of Representatives.

title.children: Albanese buoyed by Newspoll as Ley confronts Coalition's defeat

image.altText: Man sitting at outside table with grey beard and black shirt looks at camera

props.synopsis: Consumption of illicit tobacco is growing as more tobacconists pop up and revenue is lost from the legal excise.

title.children: Illicit tobacco 'in the open' but there's mixed messages on how to tackle it

image.altText: Sport underway inside proposed stadium.

props.synopsis: If either the Liberals or Labor wants to hold government in Tasmania, they will need the support of an almost entirely anti-stadium crossbench.

title.children: Tasmania's growing crossbench is mostly anti-stadium — can it still be built?

image.altText: An aerial shot of a small motorboat on a collision course with a pair of whales.

props.synopsis: The incident comes after the calf's mother was injured in a separate strike, but both whales appear to be fit enough to continue with their migration north.

title.children: Whale calf 'doing well' after collision with boat caught on camera
